content.text:
# Ballymacward

Ballymacward () is a village in County Galway, Ireland. It is on the R359 road, between that road and the rail lines traversing east–west. The village is  from Ballinasloe and approximately  from Galway city. The village is in a civil parish of the same name. It was once part of the kingdom of the Soghain of Connacht.
Ballymacward lies  north of Woodlawn railway station. This station opened in 1858 and was closed for goods traffic in 1978. It is on the main Iarnród Éireann Intercity line from Dublin to Galway, situated between Ballinasloe and Attymon halt stations.

*List of towns and villages in Ireland
